intro: Cerastium calycinum, commonly known as the snow-in-summer, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, upright stems and opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it an important plant in ecological gardens.
